ground_truth: Bob springs into action, clearing the door and flipping the dead bolt. The door is opened and Michael charges past Charlie and out into hell. With stunning calm, Michael marches straight for the pumps. In the minivan, Audrey screams as the windows begin to crack. Michael grabs a gas pump, flips the lever, and points it at the minivan. The creatures covering the car turn to look at Michael as if they've just now noticed him, and that's when he starts spraying gas at them. Up comes Michael's Glock in his other hand and blam! blam! blam! The spray of gas explodes into a spray of fire! The minivan is engulfed in flames. Creatures tear away from the car like fiery comets through the night. The windows explode, showering Audrey with tiny shards of glass. Michael drops the gas pump. He reaches through a fire-rimmed broken car window and unlocks the door. Audrey looks up to see Michael's expressionless face circled. Charlie dashes behind the counter to the sink and fills up a pitcher of water. She turns away from the sink with the filled pitcher as the boy swings the knife at her, slicing open the waitress outfit covering her pregnant belly. Charlie tumbles back to the ground behind the counter. She frantically pushes herself away from the approaching boy. She's backed against the end of the counter! The boy raises the knife to strike. Charlie grabs a baking pan off a shelf and swings it out in front of her body like a shield, as the knife is driven down. Clang! The knife hits the pan hard and stops, but the boy's hands don't. They slip off the handle and run right down the blade. The knife clatters to the ground. The boy instinctively raises his hands to strike again, but there's no knife. Charlie watches in horror as the boy calmly realizes that his thumbs are missing. Blood sprays from the stumps. Charlie pulls her legs in close then rockets them out at the boy's chest. He's catapulted away from her. Michael leaps over the counter, landing in front of Charlie, guns ready for action. Charlie shakes her head no. Jeep's light catches something on the ground. Bob flails around trying to pull the boy's small, but deadly strong arms away from his neck. Michael lowers his flashlight. A flickering light emanates from within the diner. Charlie, drenched in sweat, is writhing on the ground with Michael holding down her arms and Audrey kneeling between her legs. Bob and Jeep keep watch. The spectral lights in the distance seem to be growing larger -- closer. Jeep rests a comforting hand on his father's shoulder.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Bob leaps into movement, clearing the entry and flipping the dead bolt. The door is opened and Michael dashes past Charlie and out into chaos. With stunning composure, Michael marches straight for the dispensers. In the minivan, Audrey yells as the panes begin to fracture. Michael seizes a fuel pump, flips the lever, and directs it at the minivan. The beings covering the vehicle turn to observe Michael as if they've just now noticed him, and that's when he starts spraying fuel at them. Up comes Michael's Glock in his other hand and blam! blam! blam! The spray of fuel explodes into a spray of flame! The minivan is enveloped in fire. Creatures rip away from the car like fiery meteors through the darkness. The windows burst, showering Audrey with tiny fragments of glass. Michael drops the fuel pump. He reaches through a fire-rimmed shattered car window and unlocks the portal. Audrey looks up to see Michael's blank face encircled. Charlie races behind the counter to the basin and fills up a jug of water. She turns away from the basin with the filled jug as the boy swings the dagger at her, slicing open the waitress uniform covering her expectant belly. Charlie tumbles back to the ground behind the counter. She frantically pushes herself away from the nearing boy. She's backed against the end of the counter! The boy raises the dagger to strike. Charlie grabs a baking pan off a shelf and swings it out in front of her form like a shield, as the dagger is driven down. Clang! The dagger hits the pan hard and stops, but the boy's hands don't. They slip off the handle and run right down the blade. The dagger clatters to the ground. The boy instinctively raises his hands to strike again, but there's no dagger. Charlie watches in terror as the boy calmly realizes that his thumbs are absent. Blood sprays from the stumps. Charlie pulls her legs in close then rockets them out at the boy's torso. He's catapulted away from her. Michael vaults over the counter, landing in front of Charlie, firearms ready for action. Charlie shakes her head no. Jeep's light catches something on the ground. Bob thrashes around trying to pull the boy's small, but deadly strong limbs away from his throat. Michael lowers his flashlight. A flickering glow emanates from within the eatery. Charlie, drenched in perspiration, is writhing on the ground with Michael holding down her arms and Audrey kneeling between her legs. Bob and Jeep keep watch. The spectral lights in the expanse seem to be growing larger -- nearer. Jeep rests a comforting hand on his father's shoulder.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The door is cleared and the deadbolt is flipped by Bob as he springs into action. Michael opens the door and charges past Charlie and out into hell. Stunning calm is shown by Michael as he marches straight for the pumps. In the minivan, as the windows begin to crack, a scream is emitted by Audrey. A gas pump is grabbed by Michael, the lever is flipped, and it is pointed at the minivan. Michael is looked at by the creatures covering the car as if they've just now noticed him, and that's when gas is sprayed at them by him. Up comes Michael's Glock in his other hand, and blam! blam! blam! The gas is exploded into a spray of fire! Flames engulf the minivan. The car is torn away from by creatures like fiery comets through the night. Tiny shards of glass shower Audrey as the windows explode. The gas pump is dropped by Michael. A fire-rimmed broken car window is reached through by him, and the door is unlocked. Audrey looks up and sees Michael's expressionless face circled. Behind the counter, Charlie dashes to the sink and a pitcher of water is filled up. The filled pitcher is turned away from the sink by her, as the boy swings the knife at her, slicing open the waitress outfit covering her pregnant belly. Behind the counter, Charlie tumbles back to the ground. She frantically pushes herself away from the approaching boy. Against the end of the counter, she's backed! The knife is raised by the boy to strike. A baking pan is grabbed off a shelf by Charlie, and it is swung out in front of her body like a shield as the knife is driven down. Clang! The pan is hit hard by the knife and it stops, but the boy's hands don't. They slip off the handle and run right down the blade. The ground is clattered by the knife. Instinctively, the boy raises his hands to strike again, but no knife is present. Charlie watches in horror as the boy calmly realizes that his thumbs are missing. From the stumps, blood is sprayed. Charlie pulls her legs in close, then rockets them out at the boy's chest. Away from her, he's catapulted. Over the counter leaps Michael, landing in front of Charlie, guns ready for action. Charlie's head is shaken no by her. Something on the ground is caught by the Jeep's light. Bob flails around, trying to pull away the boy's small, but deadly strong arms from his neck. The flashlight is lowered by Michael. From within the diner, a flickering light emanates. Drenched in sweat, Charlie is writhing on the ground with her arms held down by Michael and Audrey kneeling between her legs. Bob and Jeep keep watch. The spectral lights in the distance seem to be growing larger -- closer. A comforting hand is rested on his father's shoulder by Jeep.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Bob quickly clears the door and unlocks it. Michael sprints past Charlie into chaos and heads for the pumps with stunning calm. Inside the minivan, Audrey screams as the windows crack. Michael grabs a gas pump, flips the lever, and aims at the minivan. The creatures notice him as he starts spraying gas. Michael's Glock goes off, blam! blam! blam! The gas ignites into flames, engulfing the minivan. Creatures flee like fiery comets. The windows shatter, covering Audrey with glass. Michael drops the pump, reaches through a broken window, and unlocks the door. Audrey sees his expressionless face circled by flames. Charlie runs to fill a pitcher with water, but a boy attacks, slicing her pregnant belly. She falls, backs against the counter, and grabs a baking pan to shield herself from the knife. Clang! The knife hits the pan and stops, cutting the boy's hands. Blood sprays as the boy realizes his thumbs are gone. Charlie kicks the boy away. Michael jumps over the counter, guns ready. Charlie shakes her head no. The Jeepâ€™s light reveals Bob struggling with the boy's deadly grip. Michael lowers his flashlight. Light flickers from the diner as Charlie, sweating and writhing, is held down by Michael with Audrey between her legs. Bob and Jeep maintain vigilance. The spectral lights outside grow larger. Jeep comforts his father with a hand on his shoulder.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Bob quickly unlocks and opens the door. Michael charges past Charlie, facing chaos. Calmly, he approaches the pumps. Audrey screams in the minivan as windows crack. Michael grabs the gas pump, flips the lever, and sprays gas at the creatures on the car. He fires his Glock, igniting a fire engulfing the minivan. Creatures scatter like fiery comets. Windows explode, showering Audrey with glass. Michael drops the pump, reaches through the flames, and unlocks the door. Audrey sees his expressionless face. Charlie fills a pitcher with water, dodges a boy's knife, and falls. Backed against a counter, she uses a pan to block the knife, injuring the boy's hands. The knife drops as blood sprays. Charlie kicks him away. Michael leaps over the counter, guns ready. Charlie signals no. A Jeep's light reveals Bob struggling with the boy. Michael lowers his flashlight. Inside, Charlie is restrained by Michael, with Audrey assisting. Bob and Jeep stand guard as distant spectral lights grow closer. Jeep comforts his father.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Bob quickly springs into action, deftly clearing the path to the door and skillfully flipping the deadbolt to unlock it. As the door is opened, Michael charges past Charlie with determined urgency, rushing out into what can only be described as hell. Displaying an astonishing level of calmness, Michael strides purposefully towards the gas pumps, completely unfazed. Meanwhile, inside the minivan, Audrey lets out a scream of terror as the windows begin to crack ominously under the pressure. Without hesitation, Michael grabs hold of a gas pump, expertly flips the lever, and directs its nozzle towards the minivan. The creatures that are swarming over the car suddenly turn their attention to Michael, as if they have just become aware of his presence, and that's the moment he begins spraying them with gasoline. Michael's Glock appears in his other hand, and with precise aim, he firesâ€”blam! blam! blam! Instantly, the spray of gasoline ignites into a fierce spray of fire! The minivan is immediately engulfed in flames. The creatures, now set ablaze, detach themselves from the vehicle and dart away like fiery comets streaking through the night sky. The windows of the minivan explode, showering Audrey with countless tiny shards of glass. Michael swiftly drops the gas pump and reaches through a fiery, rimmed, broken car window to unlock the door. Audrey looks up, meeting Michael's expressionless face encircled by the flames. Meanwhile, Charlie dashes behind the counter to the sink and hurriedly fills up a pitcher of water. Turning away with the filled pitcher in hand, she sees the boy swinging a knife at her, slicing through the waitress outfit that covers her pregnant belly. Charlie tumbles backward to the floor behind the counter, frantically pushing herself away from the advancing boy. She finds herself backed against the end of the counter! The boy raises the knife to strike again. Charlie snatches a baking pan off a nearby shelf, brandishing it in front of her like a shield just as the knife comes down. Clang! The knife strikes the pan with force and stops, but the boy's hands continue their momentum. They slide off the handle and run directly down the blade. The knife clatters to the ground. The boy instinctively lifts his hands to strike yet again, but he realizes there is no knife. Charlie stares in horror as the boy calmly comes to the realization that his thumbs are missing. Blood sprays forth from the stumps where his thumbs used to be. Charlie pulls her legs close to her body and then thrusts them out forcefully, launching them into the boy's chest. He is sent hurtling away from her. Michael leaps over the counter, landing with impressive agility in front of Charlie, guns ready and prepared for any action that might come. Charlie shakes her head in refusal. The Jeep's headlights catch something on the ground, and Bob struggles and flails around, trying to pull away the boy's small but deceptively strong arms from his neck. Michael lowers his flashlight, and a flickering light emanates from within the diner. Charlie, drenched in sweat, is writhing on the ground, with Michael pinning her arms down and Audrey kneeling between her legs. Bob and Jeep remain vigilant, keeping watch over the scene. The spectral lights in the distance appear to be growing larger and drawing closer. Jeep places a comforting hand on his father's shoulder.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Bob springs into action with remarkable speed, efficiently clearing the path to the door and skillfully flipping the deadbolt in order to unlock it. As the door finally swings open, Michael charges past Charlie with a sense of determined urgency, rushing out into what can only be described as utter chaos. Displaying a remarkable level of calmness, Michael strides purposefully towards the gas pumps, appearing completely unfazed by the unfolding bedlam. Meanwhile, seated inside the minivan, Audrey lets out a piercing scream of terror as the windows begin to crack ominously, succumbing to the mounting pressure. Without an instant's hesitation, Michael grabs hold of a gas pump, deftly flips the lever, and directs its nozzle towards the beleaguered minivan. The creatures, which are swarming aggressively over the car, suddenly shift their attention to Michael, as if they have just become aware of his presence, and at that pivotal moment, he commences spraying them with gasoline. In his other hand, Michael's Glock appears with a swift motion, and with precise aim, he firesâ€”blam! blam! blam! Instantly, the spray of gasoline ignites into a fierce inferno, transforming into a roaring spray of fire! The minivan is immediately engulfed in a consuming blaze. The creatures, now set ablaze, detach themselves from the vehicle and dart away like fiery comets streaking magnificently through the night sky. The windows of the minivan explode violently, showering Audrey with a multitude of tiny shards of glass. Michael swiftly drops the gas pump and expertly reaches through a fiery, rimmed, broken car window to unlock the door. Audrey looks up, meeting Michael's expressionless face, which is eerily encircled by the flames. Meanwhile, Charlie dashes behind the counter to the sink, hurriedly filling up a pitcher of water. Turning away with the filled pitcher in hand, she sees the boy swinging a knife at her, slicing through the waitress outfit that covers her pregnant belly. Charlie tumbles backward to the floor behind the counter, frantically pushing herself away from the advancing boy. She finds herself backed against the end of the counter! The boy raises the knife to strike again. Charlie snatches a baking pan off a nearby shelf, brandishing it in front of her like a shield just as the knife comes down. Clang! The knife strikes the pan with force and stops, but the boy's hands continue their momentum. They slide off the handle and run directly down the blade. The knife clatters loudly to the ground. The boy instinctively lifts his hands to strike yet again, but he suddenly realizes there is no knife in his grip. Charlie stares in horror as the boy calmly comes to the shocking realization that his thumbs are missing. Blood sprays forth from the stumps where his thumbs used to be. Charlie pulls her legs close to her body and then thrusts them out with force, propelling them into the boy's chest. He is sent hurtling away from her. Michael leaps over the counter, landing with impressive agility directly in front of Charlie, guns at the ready and prepared for any further action that might be necessary. Charlie shakes her head in resolute refusal. The Jeep's headlights catch something on the ground, casting light on Bob as he struggles and flails about, trying desperately to pull away the boy's small but deceptively powerful arms from his neck. Michael lowers his flashlight, and a flickering light emanates from within the diner. Charlie, drenched in sweat, is writhing on the ground, with Michael pinning her arms down and Audrey kneeling between her legs. Bob and Jeep remain vigilant, keeping watch over the unfolding scene. The spectral lights looming in the distance appear to be growing larger and drawing ominously closer. Jeep gently places a comforting hand on his father's shoulder, offering support amidst the chaos.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Bob, feeling a surge of urgency, springs into action by swiftly moving towards the door. With a quick, practiced motion, he clears the pathway and reaches for the deadbolt, flipping it smoothly to unlock the door. As the door swings open, Michael charges forward with determination, skillfully bypassing Charlie, and emerges into the chaotic scene outside. Displaying a stunning calm, Michael purposefully marches directly toward the gas pumps, his movements steady and unwavering. Inside the minivan, Audrey's voice pierces the air as she screams, her eyes widening in terror while the vehicle's windows begin to buckle and crack ominously. Reaching his destination, Michael quickly grabs hold of a gas pump, expertly flipping the lever, and aims it with precision at the minivan. The creatures that had been clinging to the vehicle suddenly swivel their grotesque heads, their attention snapping to Michael as if truly noticing him for the first time. It's at this moment that Michael begins to unleash a forceful spray of gasoline onto the creatures, dousing them in flammable liquid. In his other hand, Michael raises his Glock with practiced ease, and with a series of rapid movementsâ€”blam! blam! blam!â€”he fires shots that ignite the gasoline into a fiery inferno. The sudden explosion transforms the gas into a roaring spray of fire, completely engulfing the minivan in flames. In the ensuing chaos, the creatures, now engulfed by fire, detach themselves from the minivan, streaking away through the night like blazing comets. The minivan's windows succumb to the pressure and explode outward, sending a cascade of tiny glass shards showering over Audrey inside. Michael, unfazed, lets the gas pump drop from his grasp and moves with purpose toward the car's fire-rimmed, broken window. Reaching through the flames, he expertly unlocks the door, his movements precise and calculated. Audrey, shaken, looks up to see Michael's face, stoic and expressionless, circled by the flickering glow of the firelight. Meanwhile, inside the diner, Charlie reacts with urgency, rushing behind the counter to a sink where she fills a pitcher with water. As she turns away from the sink, pitcher in hand, a boy lunges at her, brandishing a knife that slices through her waitress outfit, cutting into the fabric covering her pregnant belly. Charlie's footing falters as she tumbles backward, landing hard on the ground behind the counter. Her breath quickens as she frantically pushes herself away from the boy's relentless approach, feeling the unyielding surface of the counter pressing into her back. Desperation overtakes her as the boy, his eyes cold and calculating, raises the knife high, preparing to strike down with deadly intent. In a desperate bid for survival, Charlie's hand scrambles against the shelf, grasping a baking pan. With a surge of adrenaline, she thrusts it out in front of her like a shield at the very instant the knife descends. A resonant clang echoes as the blade meets the metal pan, halting its deadly arc. The boy's hands, however, betray him as they slip from the knife's handle, sliding down its blade with a sickening inevitability. The knife clatters to the ground, forgotten, as the boy instinctively withdraws his hands, now horrifyingly aware of his missing thumbs. Blood spurts from the stumps, painting the scene with grim reality. Witnessing this, Charlie pulls her legs tightly to her body before forcefully kicking out, her feet connecting with the boy's chest, catapulting him away from her and buying her a moment of respite. Seizing this moment, Michael leaps over the counter with agility, landing protectively in front of Charlie, his guns drawn and at the ready, prepared for any further threat. Charlie, overcome with emotion, shakes her head in silent refusal, signaling to Michael that the danger has passed. Outside, the headlights of Jeep's vehicle catch something glinting on the ground, serving as a stark reminder of the night's events. Bob, struggling against the boy's small yet fiercely strong arms, grapples to free himself from the tightening grip around his neck. Michael, assessing the situation, lowers his flashlight, casting its beam over the unfolding scene to provide clarity. The flickering light emanating from within the diner adds an eerie ambiance as Charlie, drenched in sweat, writhes on the floor. Michael maintains a firm grip on her arms, restraining her movements, while Audrey positions herself between Charlie's legs, attending to her. Bob and Jeep stand vigilant, their eyes scanning the darkness for any approaching danger. The spectral lights in the distance shimmer ominously, appearing to grow larger and more foreboding with each passing moment. Jeep, sensing his father's strained nerves, rests a comforting hand on Bob's shoulder, offering silent support amidst the looming threat.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Bob quickly unlocks and opens the door, allowing Michael to charge past him into the chaos outside. With calm determination, Michael heads straight for the gas pumps as Audrey screams from inside the minivan, its windows starting to crack. Michael grabs a pump, flips the lever, and sprays gasoline at the creatures on the minivan, capturing their attention. Simultaneously, he fires his Glock, igniting the gas into flames that engulf the vehicle. The creatures flee, and the windows shatter, showering Audrey with glass. Michael then drops the pump, reaches through a broken window, and unlocks the door to save Audrey.

Inside, Charlie fills a pitcher with water but is attacked by a boy with a knife, slicing her outfit over her pregnant belly. As she retreats, Charlie uses a baking pan as a shield, blocking the knife and causing the boy to injure himself. Horrified, Charlie kicks him away. Michael leaps over the counter, ready to protect Charlie. Meanwhile, Bob struggles with the boyâ€™s grip on his neck, while a flickering light inside the diner reveals Charlie in labor, with Audrey assisting and Michael holding her arms. Bob and Jeep keep watch outside as spectral lights approach, Jeep offering comfort by resting a hand on his fatherâ€™s shoulder.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Bob springs into action, quickly moving to clear the door and flipping the dead bolt, a locking mechanism designed for security. The door is opened and Michael charges past Charlie and out into hell, a nightmarish landscape now filled with chaos. With stunning calm, Michael marches straight for the pumps, which are part of the gas station where they have taken refuge. In the minivan, Audrey screams as the windows begin to crack under pressure from the surrounding heat. Michael grabs a gas pump, flips the lever, a crucial step to dispense fuel, and points it at the minivan. The creatures covering the car, resembling nightmarish figures from a horror tale, turn to look at Michael as if they've just now noticed him, and that's when he starts spraying gas at them. Up comes Michael's Glock, a reliable semi-automatic pistol, in his other hand and blam! blam! blam! The spray of gas explodes into a spray of fire, reminiscent of a fiery eruption in a volcanic scene. The minivan is engulfed in flames. Creatures tear away from the car like fiery comets streaking through the dark night sky. The windows explode, showering Audrey with tiny shards of glass, reminiscent of a glittering rainstorm. Michael drops the gas pump. He reaches through a fire-rimmed broken car window and unlocks the door. Audrey looks up to see Michael's expressionless face circled by the intense glow of firelight. Charlie dashes behind the counter to the sink, a classic kitchen fixture, and fills up a pitcher of water needed to douse potential flames. She turns away from the sink with the filled pitcher as the boy swings the knife, a common weapon, at her, slicing open the waitress outfit covering her pregnant belly. Charlie tumbles back to the ground behind the counter. She frantically pushes herself away from the approaching boy. She's backed against the end of the counter, a space with no escape! The boy raises the knife to strike again. Charlie grabs a baking pan off a shelf, using it like a makeshift shield, as the knife is driven down. Clang! The knife hits the pan hard and stops, but the boy's hands don't. They slip off the handle and run right down the blade, a painful and dangerous mishap. The knife clatters to the ground. The boy instinctively raises his hands to strike again, but there's no knife. Charlie watches in horror as the boy calmly realizes that his thumbs are missing, a shocking and gruesome injury. Blood sprays from the stumps. Charlie pulls her legs in close, then rockets them out at the boy's chest. He's catapulted away from her. Michael leaps over the counter, landing in front of Charlie, guns ready for action, reminiscent of a hero from a high-stakes thriller. Charlie shakes her head no. Jeep's light, from the vehicle parked nearby, catches something on the ground. Bob flails around trying to pull the boy's small, but deadly strong arms away from his neck. Michael lowers his flashlight, illuminating the darkened space. A flickering light emanates from within the diner, casting eerie shadows on the walls. Charlie, drenched in sweat, is writhing on the ground with Michael holding down her arms and Audrey kneeling between her legs. Bob and Jeep keep watch. The spectral lights in the distance seem to be growing larger, suggesting an encroaching threat -- closer. Jeep rests a comforting hand on his father's shoulder, offering a moment of solidarity amidst the chaos.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles natureâ€™s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles natureâ€™s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. Charlie grabs a baking pan off a shelf and swings it out in front of her body like a shield as the knife is driven down. Clang. The knife hits the pan hard and stops but the boy's hands do not. They slip off the handle and run right down the blade. The knife clatters to the ground. The boy instinctively raises his hands to strike again but there is no knife. Charlie watches in horror as the boy calmly realizes that his thumbs are missing. Blood sprays from the stumps. Charlie pulls her legs in close then rockets them out at the boy's chest. He is catapulted away from her. Michael leaps over the counter landing in front of Charlie guns ready for action. Charlie shakes her head. no Jeep's light catches something on the ground. Bob flails around trying to pull the boy's small but deadly strong arms away from his neck. Michael lowers his flashlight. A flickering light emanates from within the diner. Charlie drenched in sweat is writhing on the ground with Michael holding down her arms and Audrey kneeling between her legs. Bob and Jeep keep watch. The spectral lights in the distance seem to be growing larger  closer. Jeep rests a comforting hand on his father's shoulder.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Bob springs into action clearing the door and flipping the dead bolt. The door is opened and Michael charges past Charlie and out into hell. With stunning calm Michael marches straight for the pumps. In the minivan Audrey screams as the windows begin to crack. Michael grabs a gas pump flips the lever and points it at the minivan. The creatures covering the car turn to look at Michael as if they have just now noticed him and that is when he starts spraying gas at them. Up comes Michael's Glock in his other hand and blam blam blam. The spray of gas explodes into a spray of fire. The minivan is engulfed in flames. Creatures tear away from the car like fiery comets through the night. Michael leaps over the counter landing in front of Charlie guns ready for action. Charlie shakes her head. no Jeep's light catches something on the ground. Bob flails around trying to pull the boy's small but deadly strong arms away from his neck. Michael lowers his flashlight. A flickering light emanates from within the diner. Charlie drenched in sweat is writhing on the ground with Michael holding down her arms and Audrey kneeling between her legs. Bob and Jeep keep watch. The spectral lights in the distance seem to be growing larger  closer. Jeep rests a comforting hand on his father's shoulder.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Tom glides into motion, sealing the window and twisting the latch. The window is nudged open and Jasper gallops past Martin into paradise. With exhilarating panic, Jasper gallops directly towards the fountains. In the RV, Lily sings as the walls begin to melt. Jasper clutches a garden hose, twists the valve, and aims it at the RV. The goblins perched on the vehicle turn to gaze at Jasper as if theyâ€™ve only now detected him, and thatâ€™s when he begins launching water at them. Up rises Jasper's slingshot in his other hand and zap! zap! zap! The stream of water transforms into a stream of ice! The RV is entombed in frost. Goblins peel away from the vehicle like icy meteors through the day. The walls disintegrate, showering Lily with tiny flakes of snow. Jasper abandons the garden hose. He stretches through a frost-covered broken vehicle wall and unlatches the window. Lily glances up to see Jasper's joyful face framed. Martin dashes behind the cash register to the refrigerator and fills up a jug of milk. She turns away from the refrigerator with the filled jug as the girl tosses the fork at her, unravelling the apron draping her empty stomach. Martin collapses back to the earth behind the cash register. She desperately drags herself away from the advancing girl. She's cornered against the side of the cash register! The girl lifts the fork to attack. Martin snatches a frying pan off a table and waves it out in front of her form like a barrier, as the fork is thrust downward. Ding! The fork strikes the pan forcefully and halts, but the girlâ€™s fingers donâ€™t. They glide off the shaft and glide right down the tines. The fork tinkers to the earth. The girl instinctively elevates her fingers to attack again, but thereâ€™s no fork. Martin witnesses in terror as the girl serenely realizes that her knuckles are absent. Water pours from the stubs. Martin pulls her arms in tight then propels them out at the girlâ€™s abdomen. Sheâ€™s launched away from her. Jasper vaults over the cash register, touching down in front of Martin, slingshots set for motion. Martin shakes her head yes. Tractorâ€™s headlamp reveals something on the floor. Tom stumbles around attempting to yank the girlâ€™s large, but shockingly weak fingers away from his waist. Jasper raises his flashlight. A steady glow radiates from beyond the cafÃ©. Martin, soaked in tears, is twisting on the earth with Jasper restraining her fingers and Lily standing between her arms. Tom and Tractor stay alert. The ghostly flashes in the horizon appear to be expanding -- nearing. Tractor places an encouraging hand on his motherâ€™s back.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Bob quickly clears the door, and Michael charges past into chaos. Unfazed, he heads to the pumps, where Audrey screams as the minivan windows crack. Michael douses the creatures on the car with gas, then ignites them with his Glock, engulfing the van in flames. Creatures flee, and shattered windows shower Audrey with glass. Michael drops the pump, reaches through the burning car window, and unlocks the door, revealing his expressionless face to Audrey. Meanwhile, Charlie fills a pitcher of water, but is attacked by a knife-wielding boy who slashes her pregnant belly. She defends herself with a baking pan, causing the knife to fall. The boy, shocked by his missing thumbs, is kicked away by Charlie. Michael jumps over the counter, ready to defend her, but Charlie shakes her head no. Bob struggles against the boy's strong grip. Michael lowers his flashlight, revealing Charlie writhing on the ground, restrained by Michael with Audrey between her legs. Bob and Jeep stand guard as distant spectral lights grow closer, and Jeep offers his father comfort.
